alert.note: Alert for Dickson; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 7:18PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM CDT FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Dickson, Giles, Hickman, Houston, Humphreys, Lawrence, Lewis, Marshall, Maury, Montgomery, Perry, Stewart and Wayne. * WHEN...From 3 AM CDT Friday through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of thunderstorms will bring heavy rain to portions of western Middle Tennessee overnight and Friday. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches, with locally higher amounts, are possible. This rainfall falling so soon after today`s heavy rain may result in flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
